    1. call(Ops, T, List)
    2. adapter(CustomGradient, Class)

Interface CustomGradient<T extends RawOpInputs>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of op this gradient is for.
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface CustomGradient<T extends RawOpInputs>
A custom gradient for ops of type T. Should be registered using TensorFlow.registerCustomGradient(Class, CustomGradient).

Creates the gradient based off of an instance of the op inputs class, which is created using reflection. To operate on the GraphOperation directly use RawCustomGradient.

The type of the op is not checked here, but it is required to match the class given to the adapter.

    TFJ_GradFuncAdapter
    adapter(CustomGradient<T> gradient, Class<T> opClass)
    Create an adapter for the custom gradient so that it can be used by native code.

  • Method Details

    • call

      List<Operand<?>> call(Ops tf, T op, List<Output<?>> gradInputs)
      Calculate the gradients for op.
      Parameters:
      tf - the Ops instance used to create ops
      op - the op to calculate the gradients of.
      gradInputs - the gradients of the op's outputs.
      Returns:
      the gradients of the op's inputs.

    • adapter

      static <T extends RawOpInputs<?>> TFJ_GradFuncAdapter adapter(CustomGradient<T> gradient, Class<T> opClass)
      Create an adapter for the custom gradient so that it can be used by native code.

      You should not be calling this yourself, use TensorFlow.registerCustomGradient(Class, CustomGradient).
